required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Heidelberg Engineering SPECTRALIS With Flex Module for In-vivo Imaging in the Supine Position
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Heidelberg Engineering SPECTRALIS With Flex Module for In-vivo Imaging in the Supine Position

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective clinical study conducted at one clinical site in the United States.

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary objectives of this study are to:
1. Compare the image quality of images between the SPECTRALIS with Flex Module and the SPECTRALIS.
2. & 3. Assess the agreement in the ability to identify abnormalities between the SPECTRALIS with Flex Module images and the SPECTRALIS images.
The secondary objective is to evaluate any adverse events found during the clinical study.

primary_outcome.measure: The image quality grade of the acquired images as determined by an independent reading center
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, average of 1 day
primary_outcome.description: OCT, OCTA and IR cSLO - graded Good (2)/Average (1)/Poor (0)

primary_outcome.measure: Agreement in identification of abnormalities of the acquired Standard OCT images between the devices
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, average of 1 day

primary_outcome.measure: Agreement in identification of abnormalities of the acquired OCTA images between the devices
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, average of 1 day

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, average of 1 day

arm_group.description: see Inclusion/Exclusion criteria; imaged with OCT and/or OCTA
see Inclusion/Exclusion criteria; imaged with OCT and/or OCTA

intervention.description: ophthalmic imaging device with head and chinrest
intervention.other_name: SPECTRALIS HRA+OCT (and variants) with OCT Angiography Module

intervention.description: ophthalmic imaging device on mobile instrumentation stand
intervention.other_name: SPECTRALIS HRA+OCT (and variants) with Flex Module

criteria.textblock:
Adult Normal Eyes Population (AN)
Inclusion Criteria for AN Population
1. Age ≥ 22 years
2. Able and willing to undergo the test procedures, sign informed consent, and follow instructions.
3. Physically able to be positioned in all required imaging positions (upright at chinrest and supine).
4. Able to fixate.
5. Best corrected visual acuity ≥ 20/40 in both eyes.
Exclusion Criteria for AN Population
1. Eye with ocular media not sufficiently clear to obtain acceptable study-related imaging.
2. Subjects who cannot tolerate the imaging procedures.
3. Clinically significant ocular disease in either eye as determined by an Investigator.
4. Ocular surgical intervention (except for refractive laser surgery or cataract surgery) in either eye.
Adult Posterior Segment Abnormality Eye Population (AD)
Inclusion Criteria for AD Population
1. Age ≥ 22 years
2. Able and willing to undergo the test procedures, sign informed consent, and follow instructions.
3. Physically able to be positioned in all required imaging positions (upright at chinrest and supine).
4. Able to fixate.
5. Eye with a structural and vascular posterior segment abnormality due to ocular disease and/or trauma.
Exclusion Criteria for AD Population
1. Eye with ocular media not sufficiently clear to obtain acceptable study-related imaging.
2. Subjects who cannot tolerate the imaging procedures.
